meanings.definition: Something, especially a building, that is very large and unsightly.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned factory was a monstrosity in the middle of town.
meanings.sent2: The old mansion was a monstrosity with its overgrown garden and broken windows.
meanings.sent3: The bright pink paint on the house turned it into a monstrosity in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The new skyscraper was a monstrosity, towering over the city like a giant.
meanings.sent5: The monstrosity of the building made it impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: An action or situation that is shockingly evil or wrong.
meanings.sent1: The crime committed was a monstrosity that shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent2: The corruption scandal was a monstrosity that tarnished the reputation of the company.
meanings.sent3: The prank they played on their friend was a monstrosity, but it was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal felt like a monstrosity, tearing apart their once close friendship.
meanings.sent5: The monstrosity of the act left a lasting impact on everyone involved.
